required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicenter Compassionate Use Protocol of Daclatasvir (BMS-790052) in Combination With Sofosbuvir With or Without Ribavirin for the Treatment of Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Compassionate Use Protocol of Daclatasvir (BMS-790052) in Combination With Sofosbuvir With or Without Ribavirin for the Treatment of Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices
Austria: Agency for Health and Food Safety

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this program is to provide Daclatasvir in combination with Sofosbuvir with or without ribavirin to subjects with chronic hepatitis C who are at a high risk of liver decompensation or death within 12 months if left untreated and who have no available therapeutic options.

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients chronically infected with Hepatitis C
- Patients at a high risk of liver decompensation or death within 12 months if left untreated and who have no available therapeutic options
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are <18 years old
- Patients who have contraindications to either Daclatasvir (DCV) or Sofosbuvir (SOF)
- Patients who are pregnant
- Creatinine clearance (CrCl) â‰¤ 30 mL/min (as estimated by Cockcroft and Gault formula)
- Patients who are pregnant or Women of Child Bearing Potential who are not using required contraception

overall_contact_backup.last_name: First line of email MUST contain NCT# & Site#. Only trial site that are recruiting have contact information at this time
